bioghist.p: The Commission on University Structures and Programs (CUSP) was formed by Villanova University President Edward McCarthy in 1973 to examine all activities of the University, both academic and non-academic, and to make recommendations to the President and the Board of Trustees concerning steps that might be taken to strengthen the University academically and financially. The Commission was made up of nine faculty members, three students, and six administrators, with every College and School being represented. The analysis included self-evaluations, evaluation reports from accrediting agencies, and evaluations by consultants from off-campus. The Report of the Commission on University Structures and Programs was submitted to President John M. Driscoll in February 1977.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Commission on University Structures and Programs (CUSP). Materials include: minutes of the Commission's meetings (1973-1975); evaluation reports of departments, programs, and academic and non-academic services; sample questionnaires; and a copy of the final CUSP report (1977).
